newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - First USA soars on deal.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - First USA soars on deal.

text.p: First USA Inc's agreement to be acquired by Banc One Corp for $7.3 billion in stock, or about $52.61 per share, rallied First USA investors, sending the stock up 11-1/4 to 48 before Monday's market open.
Meanwhile, Banc One shares slipped to 42-1/2 from 45-1/8.
The companies said they agreed to merge in an exchange of 1.1659 Banc One shares for each First USA share.
Elsewhere, Microsoft Corp shares fell 1-1/8 to 86 preceding Monday's market open, weakness traders attributed to the company's warning on Friday of slower earnings growth.

"Microsoft reported earnings a few pennies better (than analyst expectations), but in the past six or seven quarters they talk down future growth rates and they really overdid it this time in the conference call," a trader said.
Microsoft said it earned $0.57 per share in the fiscal second quarter versus $0.45 per share one year ago.
According to Zack's Investment Research, the consensus analyst forecast was $0.51 per share.
Biogen Inc fell 1-1/2 to 44-1/4 in selling inspired by Smith Barney's lowering the stock to outperform from buy, according to traders.
In other pre-open activity, Intel Corp edged lower to 144-1/8 from 144-3/4 while MCI Communications inched up to 35-1/4 from 35-1/8.
Madge Networks NV added one to 13-5/8 after it announced the release of new technology to speed up capacity-constrained networks at a lower cost than existing router technology.

Also, Legato Systems Inc rose to 24-1/2 from 22-7/8, VLSI Technology added 5/8 to 18 after falling 5-7/8 on Friday and PictureTel added 1-1/2 to 22 after saying its fourth quarter per share earnings will meet analyst estimates.
